featured.text: And there are plenty of models from which to choose: from simple $200 point-and-shoot snappers to $1,000 wonders with all the features that any advanced amateur could want.
There was plenty of landscape for him to paint in America, much different from his hometown.
In these places people rest, get plenty of sleep, eat healthy food, drink water instead of wine, and exercise in various ways.
(H) Alexander Well, they taste good if you add plenty of spices and sauces.
To trick the monkeys into the belief that there is plenty of space around.

definition.en_def: A large or sufficient amount of something.
definition.example: There is plenty of food for everyone at the party.
